title: Entropy change of dissolution of CuCl

content.question: Which of the following best explains what the particle diagram is able to show about the entropy change for the dissolution of <math alttext="C u C l solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CuCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> in pure water?

choices.label: The particle diagram shows that the dissociation of <math alttext="C u C l solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CuCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> into ions contributes to an increase in the entropy for the dissolution.

The particle diagram shows that the dissociation of <math alttext="C u C l solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CuCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> into ions contributes to a decrease in the entropy for the dissolution.
The particle diagram shows that there is no reorganization of the water molecules around the ions and the change in entropy for the dissolution is zero.
The particle diagram shows that there are no interactions between the water molecules and the change in entropy for the dissolution is zero.

content.answer: The particle diagram shows that the dissociation of <math alttext="C u C l solid" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>CuCl</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> into ions contributes to an increase in the entropy for the dissolution.
